channel.title: Max level to wear cape
channel.description: Okay, so.. well I dont have 600+ items, im to much of a retard to get those to work, so I decided to make the quest point cape my "max cape" so what I did was add a npc, who would ask you if you have atleast 99 in every skill, if you say yes he hands the items over, and sends a new dialogue. So my question is how do I make it so when you click "yes" that you have gotten 99 , it checks your total level?

item.title: Max level to wear cape
item.dc:creator: @ezzi ezzi
item.description:
@ezzi wrote:

Thanks ohokay, I got it to work with your code

Read full topic

item.title: Max level to wear cape
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:9, topic:473934”] for (int i = 0; i < SKILLS_AMOUNT; i++) { if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[i]) != 99) { sm("You don't have 99 in all skills"); return; } } [/quote]

A Loop is too advanced for Mopar.

Read full topic

item.title: Max level to wear cape
item.dc:creator: @ezzi ezzi
item.description:
@ezzi wrote:

Would I put 21 for SKILL_AMOUNT or just add that to my config, and itd be like public boolean SKILL_AMOUNT = 21;

Read full topic

item.title: Max level to wear cape
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Well if you have totalLevel declared, and it returns the correct total level, yes, use that.

If not, you could just check that each skill is 99 before giving the cape. Something like…

		for (int i = 0; i < SKILLS_AMOUNT; i++) {
			if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[i]) != 99) {
			sm("You don't have 99 in all skills");
			return;
			}
		}

Read full topic

item.title: Max level to wear cape
item.dc:creator: @ezzi ezzi
item.description:
@ezzi wrote:

Yeah,but if I do all the skills like how you suggested, wouldnt it just be a shit ton of code, when it could be like if (c.totalLevel <= 2079

Read full topic

item.title: Max level to wear cape
item.dc:creator: @RSPS222 RSPS222
item.description:
@RSPS222 wrote:

i know bro that he want to check for all 99 stats so as i said
if(playerLevel[15] >= 99) {
so do it for all of the stats and then add a }else{
sendMessage(“You are not strong enough to wear that powerful Cape!”);
}
thats what you need? just add it to a dialog i think thats could be helpful
Sorry If english not good

Read full topic

item.title: Max level to wear cape
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RSPS222, post:5, topic:473934”]i think maybe you should do something like this :
if(playerLevel[15] >= 99) {
[15] = herblore skill, >= 99 means if herblore skill = or higher then 99 then:
if(playerLevel[15] >= 99) {
addItem(15011, 1); Put here your item Id (max cape)
}else{ if the level is under 99
sendMessage(“You are not strong enough to wear that powerful Cape!”)
}
but dialogs i dont know
i dont know maybe you can use it Anyways Enjoy-
Sorry For english[/quote]
He wants it so it checks that the player has 99 in all stats…
Again. Using the total level method would be suitable…

Read full topic
